channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK

item.title: Report E-2023080033
item.description:
Report E-2023080033

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 14, 2023, one (1) 48-pound box of HA powder (UN3262) was forked and released one (1) pound of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. LSH neutralized the released material and utilized absorbents to collect the spent product. All clean up debris and the damaged box were contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The drum was labeled and staged onsite for profiling and disposal by R+L personnel.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading the trailer, one battery was found damaged and leaking. The release was properly managed. The damaged battery was placed into a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2023080078
item.description:
Report X-2023080078

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package brought to QA, leaking. Placed in tote to prevent further leakage. DescribePack: Pail seems to be leaking from the bottom seam, appears to be due to quality of container and material. No outer packaging to brace contents during transport. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tote to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report E-2023070970
item.description:
Report E-2023070970

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into the one metal 55 gallon drum of isopropanol (un1219) releasing 0.5 quarts of product. Contractors were dispatched for the cleanup and containment of the release.
